title: Piglence Light - a decorative geometric font
content:
Hello Typophile Forum,

I finally finished the uppercase part of my new font: Piglence.  
I'd love to hear your comment or feedback for the proportion of a few glyphs, like the O, Q, G and Y.  
Not sure if they're having good balance.

Thanks in advance,  
Cheers!

~ A u d e e

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170646im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Piglence-Light-A-Z_5558.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170646im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Piglence-Light-A-F_6191.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170646im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Piglence-Light-C_3931.jpg)
author: audeemirza

comments.content: /H, /K, /X, /V, /Z are too wide. /M and /W are too narrow. Get rid of the /C with the straight side and use the rounded /C, but fix the upper left curve. Upper right curve of the /D, /G, /O also need work. To help you see the imbalance, flip the glyph upside-down when you look at it; errors become much more apparent.
The E looks top heavy to me and I agree with George on the too wide letters.
